They offered a sacrifice of a fiery flying serpent, which was said to have had two wings, like the wings of a bird protruding at its neck about a cubit. When flying, it would spread its wings and appeared in the shape of a cross. The serpent that Moses raised on a pole had two feathers stuck to its sides. All those who looked at it lived, foretelling the cross of Jesus Christ.
